overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Sanctuary
overall_perception_summary.description: Dr. Althea positions itself as a precise, dermatologist-led intervention for compromised skin. By merging sterile lab codes with a 'Soul Liberation' ethos, it reframes acne treatment not just as medical repair, but as a restoration of peace. It acts as The Guardian, offering a protective, verified shield against sensitivity and inflammation.

foundation.title: The Healing Authority
foundation.description: The brand anchors its authority in the clinic ('Derma Lab', 'ISO 22716') while directing its mission toward specific pathology repair ('Post-acne', 'Relief'). It operates on a Safety First value system, prioritizing 'Hypoallergenic' tolerance over aggressive actives. The positioning is The Medical Authority, serving as a trusted pharmacy-grade solution for sensitive skin.

identity.title: Soulful Science
identity.description: The personality is The Reliable Expert, maintaining professional distance while offering 'Soul Liberation'—a hint of Caregiver warmth. The Archetype mix is dominated by the Caregiver (60%) and Sage (30%), driven by a desire to soothe and educate. Visually, it adheres to a Pharma-Code aesthetic: sterile white, grid layouts, and minimalist typography.

communication.title: Evidenced-Based Relief
communication.description: Messaging acts as The Problem Solver, using rational data ('+177.34% Hydration') to prove efficacy. The USP is The Specialist, targeting the specific niche of post-acne recovery with a proprietary '345' system. Content Focus is Science Education, prioritizing ingredient transparency and clinical stats over lifestyle fluff.

benefits.title: Restorative Peace
benefits.description: Functionally, the product delivers Restoration, fixing broken barriers and calming inflammation. Emotionally, it provides Relief / Safety, removing the anxiety of skin flares. It signals The Purist identity—a choice driven by 'Clean' ethics and 'Vegan' standards. Socially, it fits The Knowledge Club of skintellectuals who seek verified 'Real Herb Therapy'.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The brand name 'Dr. Althea' and 'Derma Lab' branding explicitly anchor authority in the clinic (Slider A: 2/5). The product name 'Relief Cream' and claims like 'Post-acne marks' and 'Soothing' define the mission as fixing a pathology rather than general enhancement (Slider B: 2/5). This maps perfectly to The Healer territory.
marker_1.evidence: Dr. Althea... 345 Relief Cream... Post-acne marks... Derma Inspired... Soothes and improves skin texture

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Clinical authority + Repair mission aligns perfectly with The Healer territory.

marker_2.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on 'Post-acne' and 'Sensitive skin' issues (Slider A: 1/5). However, the 'For all skin types' claim and 'Clean Formula' positioning, along with standard packaging formats, suggest this is an approachable solution rather than an exclusive velvet-rope brand (Slider B: 4/5). It democratizes clinical relief.
marker_2.evidence: Post-acne marks... Blemishes... FOR ALL SKIN TYPES... Clean Formula... All-in-one skincare solution

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Micro-focus on acne coupled with broad 'all skin types' access aligns with The Democratizers.

marker_3.reasoning: The priority is clear: 'Hypoallergenic,' 'Skin Irritation Tested,' and 'Clean Formula' signal that safety is the prerequisite for performance (Slider A: 1/5). Transparency is high, with explicit ingredient lists ('Tea Tree,' 'Ceramide NP') and specific clinical trial results ('+177.34%') presented as evidence (Slider B: 2/5).
marker_3.evidence: Hypoallergenic... Skin Irritation Tested for Sensitive Skin... Clean Formula... +177.34% Increase in Skin Hydration

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Low tolerance for risk (Hypoallergenic) combined with high data density (Clinical stats) maps directly to Safety First.

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is stark white, text-heavy, and uses serif fonts that evoke a prescription label or lab report (Slider A: 2/5). The product is framed as a functional necessity ('Relief Cream,' 'Daily use') rather than a luxury object, placing it in the realm of trusted utility (Slider B: 2/5).
marker_4.evidence: Minimalist... clinical... monochrome palette... Dr. Atelier DERMA LAB... MOISTURE SKIN RELIEF CREAM

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Clinical aesthetic + utility positioning creates The Medical Authority territory.

marker_5.reasoning: The brand speaks with the voice of a specialist: 'Clinical Herb Formula,' 'ISO 22716,' 'Dermatologist Tested.' It creates distance to establish authority (Slider B: 4/5). While 'Soul Liberation' adds a tiny drop of warmth, the overwhelming signal is professional competence (Slider A: 2/5).
marker_5.evidence: Clinical Herb Formula... ISO 22716... Dermatologist Tested... Dr. Althea... 345 Relief Cream

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: High authority signals (Dr, ISO, Clinical) with low warmth creates The Reliable Expert.

marker_6.reasoning: The dominant energy is The Caregiver (60%), focused on 'Relief,' 'Soothing,' and safety ('Hypoallergenic,' 'Sensitive Skin'). This is supported by The Sage (30%), which provides the 'Dr.' authority and 'Clinical trial' data to validate the care. A hint of The Innocent (10%) appears in the 'Clean Formula' and 'Vegan' claims.
marker_6.evidence: Relief Cream... Soothing... Hypoallergenic... Clinical trial... Clean Formula... Vegan

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Archetype mix derived from content analysis.

marker_7.reasoning: The tone is serious and data-driven. Phrases like 'Clinical trial conducted,' 'Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%,' and 'ISO 22716' leave no room for humor or hype. It sounds like a lab report or a prescription insert.
marker_7.evidence: Clinical trial conducted by Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%... ISO 22716... Non-comedogenic

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Zero humor + low enthusiasm + high formality = The Clinical Authority.

marker_8.reasoning: The visual language is stark white backgrounds, black serif typography, and rigid grid layouts (Slider B: 1/5). The temperature is cold and clinical, using white and light green to signal 'sterile nature' rather than 'warm garden' (Slider A: 1/5). It looks like medical packaging.
marker_8.evidence: Minimalist, clinical... monochrome palette... White tube with densely packed black text... Grid-style ingredient sectioning
marker_8.look_and_feel: Minimalist, clinical, and premium —an emphasis on professional-grade formulation and performance-driven skincare.
distinctive_assets: Dense black serif typography on white
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical monochrome (Black/White) with accents of soft medical green and highlighter yellow.

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Sterile temp + Swiss grid layout creates Pharma-Code territory.

marker_9.reasoning: The messaging leads with the solution ('Relief Cream', 'Post-acne') and supports it with specific features like 'Tea Tree Leaf Water' (Slider A: 3/5). The persuasion is rooted in raw data: '+177.34% Hydration' and 'Clinical trial' citations (Slider B: 1/5). It identifies a problem and mathematically proves the fix.
marker_9.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Post-acne marks... Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%... Improvement in Soothing Effect +8.88%

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Feature/Result focus + Data-driven persuasion aligns with The Problem Solver.

marker_10.reasoning: The protagonist is 'Dr. Althea' and the 'Derma Lab,' suggesting professional expertise (Slider A: 2/5). The setting is explicitly the lab: 'ISO 22716,' 'Clinical trial conducted by Korea Institute,' and imagery of scientific glass apparatus (Slider B: 2/5). Nature is present ('Herb Therapy'), but it is contained *within* the lab.
marker_10.evidence: Dr. Althea... Dr. Atelier DERMA LAB... Clinical Herb Formula... Scientific glass apparatus imagery

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Professional protagonist + Lab setting maps to The Lab Breakthrough.

marker_11.reasoning: Validation comes from the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' and 'Dr. Atelier DERMA LAB' (Slider A: 2/5). The proof is numerical and visual data: specific percentage increases and clinical test icons (Slider B: 1/5). It relies on the authority of the white coat.
marker_11.evidence: Clinical trial conducted by Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... +177.34%... +8.88%... Dermatologist Tested

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Lab validation + Graph proof aligns with Derm-Validation territory.

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP CLAIM (What Makes You Unique)
marker_12.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Problem Solver (Targets specific skin concern)
marker_12.reasoning: The unique claim is the '345 Relief Cream' system and 'Clinical Herb Formula'—a proprietary blend logic (Slider A: 3/5). The scope is narrow and problem-focused: 'Post-acne,' 'Blemishes,' 'Sensitive' (Slider B: 4/5). This defines a Specialist brand, not a generalist.
marker_12.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Clinical Herb Formula... Post-acne marks... Blemishes... Uneven skin tone

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Signature complex + Problem-solving scope creates The Specialist territory.

marker_13.reasoning: The gallery is dedicated to education and proof. It features ingredient breakdown infographics, clinical trial data cards, and detailed benefit checklists (Slider A: 2/5). The goal is to build trust through evidence, not just to sell a vibe (Slider B: 1/5).
marker_13.evidence: Clinical trial... Ingredients... Tea Tree Leaf Water... Key Ingredients infographic... Clinical result percentages

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Explainer depth + Thesis intent aligns with Science Education.

marker_14.reasoning: The product is a mechanic for repair. It explicitly targets 'soothing,' 'calming,' and 'post-acne' recovery (Slider A: 4/5). The outcome is biological health—restoring the barrier and hydration levels ('+177%')—rather than just cosmetic perfection (Slider B: 1/5).
marker_14.evidence: Soothes and improves skin texture... Post-acne marks... Blemishes... Improvement in Soothing Effect

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Healer action + Biological outcome maps directly to Restoration.

marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: The primary emotional payoff is the removal of anxiety. 'Relief Cream,' 'Hypoallergenic,' and 'Skin Irritation Tested' all offer Reassurance (Slider A: 2/5). The 'Soul Liberation' tagline hints at an internal state of peace or Sanctuary, confirming the inward focus (Slider B: 1/5).
marker_15.evidence: Relief Cream... Hypoallergenic... Skin Irritation Tested... Soul Liberation... Soothing

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Reassurance + Sanctuary aligns with Relief / Safety territory.

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Smart Choice (because it makes sense)
marker_16.reasoning: Buying this product signals a rational, ethical choice. The 'Vegan,' 'Clean Formula,' and 'ISO 22716' claims appeal to someone who values purity and standards (Slider A: 2/5). It occupies a curated, enthusiast niche ('Dr. Althea,' 'Herb Therapy') rather than a mass commodity space (Slider B: 3/5).
marker_16.evidence: Clean Formula... Vegan... ISO 22716... Dr. Atelier DERMA LAB... Real Herb Therapy

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Smart/Ethical choice + Curated niche aligns with The Purist.

marker_17.reasoning: This brand appeals to 'skintellectuals' who understand what '345' refers to and why 'Ceramide NP' + 'Tea Tree' is a good combo. It offers membership in The Knowledge Club—those who research their ingredients and trust data over hype.
marker_17.evidence: Ceramide NP / Panthenol / Niacinamide... Clinical trial conducted... 3 4 5 1 REAL HERB THERAPY

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Membership in an enthusiast group based on technical knowledge aligns with The Knowledge Club.
